intro: Abacosa kingii, commonly known as the King's abacosa, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, hairy stems. The plant features narrow, sword-shaped leaves with a velvety texture, and its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in dense clusters. Abacosa kingii thrives in well-drained soils and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
